newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan CD rates unchanged, 15 mln dinars offered.
newsitem.headline: Jordan CD rates unchanged, 15 mln dinars offered.

text.p: Interest yields from Jordan's Central Bank certificates of deposit auction on Saturday were unchanged at up to 9.25 percent for three-month CDs and up to 9.50 percent for six months, the bank said on Sunday.
The bank said the 15 million dinar ($21 million) offering was fully subscribed, but gave no breakdown of the three-month and six-month bills.
It said it was offering a further 15 million dinars in CDs in next Saturday's auction.
Repurchase agreements as collatoral to weekly CDs remained at 10 percent with an unchanged 8.5 percent discount rate.
Outstanding CDs stood at 550.9 million ($778 million).

The Central Bank is maintaining a high interest rate policy to preserve the attractiveness of dinar-denominated assets and curb any excessive outflow of dinars into dollar-denominated assets that could erode its foreign currency reserves.
